neighbors.name: Frank C. Pegues & Tina M. Pegues
neighbors.claims: Frank C. Pegues and Tina M. Pegues are residents of Charles Town, WV ([National Public Data](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/p/frank-pegues/)). There is no public record of their involvement in community planning or development debates, and they do not appear in local farmland preservation rosters.
neighbors.influence_justification: Private residents; no public roles found

approach_recommendations.engage: Use a personal, neighborly approach via a trusted local intermediary. Emphasize listening to any concerns about property or lifestyle impacts.

citations.claim: Frank C. Pegues and Tina M. Pegues are residents of Charles Town, WV
citations.title: Frank Pegues - National Public Data

neighbors.name: Joseph P. Johnson
neighbors.claims: Joseph P. Johnson is a property owner in the vicinity. While a prominent former Virginia House of Delegates member shares this name ([E&E News](https://legacy-assets.eenews.net/open_files/assets/2013/10/09/document_gw_02.pdf)), no conclusive evidence links that public figure to this Jefferson County property. No news reports or community records indicate any stance or activism by this Joseph P. Johnson on local land-use proposals.
neighbors.influence_justification: No known civic engagement in county

approach_recommendations.engage: Initiate a polite, informal conversation to introduce the project. Allow Johnson to voice any questions regarding local property values and community character.

citations.claim: While a prominent former Virginia House of Delegates member shares this name
citations.title: CoalBlue Project Letter

neighbors.name: Calvin L. Togans & Cynthia C. Togans
neighbors.claims: Calvin L. Togans and Cynthia C. Togans are property owners in Jefferson County. Calvin L. Togans is a long-time resident who received a degree from Shepherd College in 1981 ([Spirit of Jefferson](https://sjf.stparchive.com/Archive/SJF/SJF06181981P03.php)). Their names do not appear in recent community petitions or farmland preservation rosters, suggesting no active role in local land-use debates.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via a friendly in-person visit. Emphasize respect for local traditions and answer any questions about how the project will address quality-of-life concerns.

citations.claim: Calvin L. Togans is a long-time resident who received a degree from Shepherd College in 1981
citations.title: Spirit of Jefferson Farmers Advocate June 18, 1981

neighbors.name: George E. Newman Jr. & Joyce A. Newman
neighbors.claims: Joyce A. Newman is a resident of Charles Town, WV, listed at the property address since 2011 ([National Public Data](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/n/joyce-newman/)). While a George E. Newman Jr. appears in regional records, including a 1972 graduate in Charleston, WV ([Pike Archive](http://www.pikearchive.org/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/PKA_SD_2003_AUTUMN.pdf)), specific details linking him to this Jefferson County parcel or military service could not be verified. The Newmans have not made any known public comments on local development proposals.

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respected community member reach out to discuss the project informally. Building rapport on common ground and clearly explaining plans can encourage openness.

citations.claim: Joyce A. Newman is a resident of Charles Town, WV, listed at the property address since 2011
citations.title: Joyce Newman - National Public Data

citations.claim: including a 1972 graduate in Charleston, WV
citations.title: Shield & Diamond Autumn 2003

neighbors.name: Donald K. Mickey & Gail H. Mickey
neighbors.claims: Donald K. Mickey and Gail H. Mickey are local landowners. Donald K. Mickey served Jefferson County schools for 30 years, notably as coordinator of guidance and testing ([Spirit of Jefferson](https://sjf.stparchive.com/Archive/SJF/SJF10261967P01.php)). In recognition of his service, the county designated June 23, 1989, as "Donald K. Mickey Day" ([Spirit of Jefferson](https://sjf.stparchive.com/Archive/SJF/SJF06081989P02.php)). Gail H. Mickey is identified as his wife in family obituaries ([Dignity Memorial](https://www.dignitymemorial.com/obituaries/richmond-va/hilda-hindman-6225649)). They have not appeared in recent county farmland program records or land-use advocacy efforts.
neighbors.influence_justification: Retired school official; honored by county

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Mickeys through a neighborly introduction, acknowledging Donald's service to the county schools. Emphasize transparency about the project timeline and assurances regarding maintenance of local roadways and scenery.

citations.claim: Donald K. Mickey served Jefferson County schools for 30 years, notably as coordinator of guidance and testing
citations.title: Spirit of Jefferson Farmers Advocate Oct 26, 1967

citations.claim: the county designated June 23, 1989, as "Donald K. Mickey Day"
citations.title: Spirit of Jefferson Farmers Advocate June 8, 1989

citations.claim: Gail H. Mickey is identified as his wife in family obituaries
citations.title: Obituary of Hilda Mitchell Hindman
